Introduction to FactoMineR2

Source: vignettes/FactoMineR2.Rmd
FactoMineR2.Rmd

FactoMineR2 was designed to return same result as FactoMineR but with a more modern and tidyverse-friendly syntax. This document aims to show the differences between the two packages.

library(dplyr)
library(FactoMineR)
library(FactoMineR2)
library(magrittr)
data(decathlon)

Eigs 

# Get eigvalues and eigvectors with FactoMineR
res_pca <- PCA(decathlon, quanti.sup = 11:12, quali.sup=13, graph = FALSE, scale = TRUE, ncp = 5)
head(res_pca$eig)
#>        eigenvalue percentage of variance cumulative percentage of variance
#> comp 1  3.2719055              32.719055                          32.71906
#> comp 2  1.7371310              17.371310                          50.09037
#> comp 3  1.4049167              14.049167                          64.13953
#> comp 4  1.0568504              10.568504                          74.70804
#> comp 5  0.6847735               6.847735                          81.55577
#> comp 6  0.5992687               5.992687                          87.54846
# Get eigvalues and eigvectors with FactoMineR2
X_sup <- decathlon[, 11:13]
X_active <- decathlon[, -c(11:13)]

eigs <- X_active |>
    standardize_norm(scale = TRUE) |>
    get_eigen()

df_eigs <- eigs |>
  extract(1) |>
  as.data.frame() |>
  rename(eigenvalue = values) |>
  mutate(
    `percentage of variance` = eigenvalue / sum(eigenvalue) * 100,
    `cumulative percentage of variance` = cumsum(`percentage of variance`)
  ) |>
  set_rownames(paste0("comp.", 1:nrow(eigs$vectors)))
  
df_eigs |> head()
#>        eigenvalue percentage of variance cumulative percentage of variance
#> comp.1  3.2719055              32.719055                          32.71906
#> comp.2  1.7371310              17.371310                          50.09037
#> comp.3  1.4049167              14.049167                          64.13953
#> comp.4  1.0568504              10.568504                          74.70804
#> comp.5  0.6847735               6.847735                          81.55577
#> comp.6  0.5992687               5.992687                          87.54846

PCA

Individuals 

# Get principal components with FactoMineR
head(res_pca$ind$coord)
#>              Dim.1      Dim.2      Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE   0.7916277  0.7716112  0.8268412  1.1746274  0.7071590
#> CLAY     1.2349906  0.5745781  2.1412470 -0.3548448 -1.9745714
#> KARPOV   1.3582149  0.4840209  1.9562580 -1.8565241  0.7952147
#> BERNARD -0.6095151 -0.8746285  0.8899407  2.2206124  0.3616362
#> YURKOV  -0.5859683  2.1309542 -1.2251568  0.8735791  1.2513692
#> WARNERS  0.3568895 -1.6849567  0.7665531 -0.5893047  1.0016616
# Get principal components with FactoMineR2
X_active <- X_active |> standardize(scale = TRUE)
vectors <- X_active |> eigvectors()
ind_coords <- X_active |> pca_ind_coords(vectors)
ind_coords[,1:5]  |> head()
#>              Dim.1      Dim.2      Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE   0.7916277 -0.7716112  0.8268412  1.1746274  0.7071590
#> CLAY     1.2349906 -0.5745781  2.1412470 -0.3548448 -1.9745714
#> KARPOV   1.3582149 -0.4840209  1.9562580 -1.8565241  0.7952147
#> BERNARD -0.6095151  0.8746285  0.8899407  2.2206124  0.3616362
#> YURKOV  -0.5859683 -2.1309542 -1.2251568  0.8735791  1.2513692
#> WARNERS  0.3568895  1.6849567  0.7665531 -0.5893047  1.0016616
# Get individual cos2 with FactoMineR
head(res_pca$ind$cos2)
#>              Dim.1      Dim.2      Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE  0.11167888 0.10610262 0.12183534 0.24588345 0.08911755
#> CLAY    0.12400941 0.02684265 0.37278712 0.01023775 0.31701007
#> KARPOV  0.15991886 0.02030911 0.33175306 0.29878849 0.05481905
#> BERNARD 0.04867778 0.10023262 0.10377289 0.64611132 0.01713585
#> YURKOV  0.03769960 0.49858212 0.16480554 0.08379015 0.17193305
#> WARNERS 0.02160805 0.48164324 0.09968563 0.05891525 0.17021193
# Get individual cos2 with FactoMineR2
ind_cos2 <- ind_coords |> pca_ind_cos2()
ind_cos2[,1:5] |> head()
#>              Dim.1      Dim.2      Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE  0.11167888 0.10610262 0.12183534 0.24588345 0.08911755
#> CLAY    0.12400941 0.02684265 0.37278712 0.01023775 0.31701007
#> KARPOV  0.15991886 0.02030911 0.33175306 0.29878849 0.05481905
#> BERNARD 0.04867778 0.10023262 0.10377289 0.64611132 0.01713585
#> YURKOV  0.03769960 0.49858212 0.16480554 0.08379015 0.17193305
#> WARNERS 0.02160805 0.48164324 0.09968563 0.05891525 0.17021193
# Get individual contributions with FactoMineR
head(res_pca$ind$contrib)
#>              Dim.1     Dim.2    Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE  0.46715109 0.8359506 1.186888  3.1842186  1.7811617
#> CLAY    1.13695340 0.4635341 7.959744  0.2905893 13.8872052
#> KARPOV  1.37515734 0.3289363 6.643820  7.9543342  2.2523610
#> BERNARD 0.27693912 1.0740657 1.374952 11.3801552  0.4658144
#> YURKOV  0.25595504 6.3757577 2.605847  1.7611939  5.5775065
#> WARNERS 0.09494738 3.9862179 1.020117  0.8014610  3.5736432
# Get individual contributions with FactoMineR2
ind_contrib <- ind_coords |> pca_ind_contrib(df_eigs$eigenvalue)
ind_contrib[,1:5] |> head()
#>              Dim.1     Dim.2    Dim.3      Dim.4      Dim.5
#> SEBRLE  0.46715109 0.8359506 1.186888  3.1842186  1.7811617
#> CLAY    1.13695340 0.4635341 7.959744  0.2905893 13.8872052
#> KARPOV  1.37515734 0.3289363 6.643820  7.9543342  2.2523610

#> WARNERS 0.09494738 3.9862179 1.020117  0.8014610  3.5736432

Variables 

# Get variable coordinates with FactoMineR
head(res_pca$var$coord)
#>                  Dim.1      Dim.2       Dim.3       Dim.4       Dim.5
#> 100m        -0.7747198  0.1871420 -0.18440714 -0.03781826  0.30219639
#> Long.jump    0.7418997 -0.3454213  0.18221105  0.10178564  0.03667805
#> Shot.put     0.6225026  0.5983033 -0.02337844  0.19059161  0.11115082
#> High.jump    0.5719453  0.3502936 -0.25951193 -0.13559420  0.55543957
#> 400m        -0.6796099  0.5694378  0.13146970  0.02930198 -0.08769157
#> 110m.hurdle -0.7462453  0.2287933 -0.09263738  0.29083103  0.16432095
# Get variable coordinates with FactoMineR2
var_coords <- df_eigs$eigenvalue |> pca_var_coords(vectors)
var_coords[,1:5] |> head()
#>                  Dim.1      Dim.2       Dim.3       Dim.4       Dim.5
#> 100m        -0.7747198 -0.1871420 -0.18440714 -0.03781826  0.30219639
#> Long.jump    0.7418997  0.3454213  0.18221105  0.10178564  0.03667805
#> Shot.put     0.6225026 -0.5983033 -0.02337844  0.19059161  0.11115082
